availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Benjamin Franklin “Frank” Price (Johnson County, Kentucky, resident)

body.p: Johnson County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Son of Jesse Price, Sr., and Lynchie Price. Married to Sarah A. Huff Price in 1860. Father of Jerome Price and Laura Price. Student and farmer in Johnson County in 1850. Merchant in Johnson County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Johnson County, p. 102B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Johnson County, p. 149.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Floyd County, Precinct 7, p. 602A.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records – Microfilm (1852-1914), KDLA, Film #994027-994058: Johnson County Marriages (1852-1914), 1861, p. 4 of 5 of microfilm.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records (Provost Marshal General's Bureau; Consolidated Enrollment Lists, 1863-1865), NARA RG 110, Kentucky, 9th Congressional District, Johnson County, Vol. 2 of 3, October 1863, p. 294, p. 87 of 212 of microfilm), (Accessed via ancestry.com on August 13, 2020).
Find A Grave, “Benjamin Franklin Price (1833-1873)," Memorial 86244021, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/86244021/benjamin-franklin-price (accessed August 20, 2020).
